page.title: 04BRILL WINDMILL,OLD HOUSES.
page.content: Buckinghamshire,Oxfordshire,Bedford- shire,Northamptonshire,Berkshire and Hertfordshire can be seen from Brill. A windmill sits on a hill 615ft.high.It is a post mill and was once used for grinding barley and corn.It is open to the public from April until the end of September from 2 to 5pm.on Sundays. Another windmill which used to stand on North Hills was struck by lightning in 1905.This year people in Brill are celebrating the tercentenary of the windmill with a 2 day faire. Brill has several interesting listed old buildings including 18c.vicarage and Brill House,16c.manor house and 19c.Waterloo House.None are open to the public.The windmill sails are turned twice a year and it is looked after by the County Council.The last major repair was in 1975 when the sails were renewed and shortened.
